text: ___________ is a document which specifies the contents of any form of packaging, e.g. boxes, containers, cartons, without indicating the value of the goods shipped.
___________ is a mode of shipping when one person's shipment takes up a full container.

___________ means packaging material into smaller quantities by means of thin, transparent plastic material that tightly covers the thing that it is wrapped around, used for protecting goods when they are being transported or sold. (Quá trình bọc một vật thể trong một màng nhựa sau đó được nung nóng để co lại chặt xung quanh vật thể đó.)
___________ is a framework that carries a wheel set, attached to a vehicle so that it can move on rail.

___________ is designed to store pallets in a mechanical and functional way using forklifts. These forklifts access goods through aisles parallel to the racks. (là loại kệ Pallet được thiết kế để lưu trữ Pallet theo cách cơ học và cơ năng bằng cách sử dụng xe nâng hàng.)
___________ means reducing costs per unit by increasing production. (là lợi thế về chi phí mà các công ty có được khi tăng sản lượng sản xuất và giảm chi phí.)

options.c: Economies of scale (kinh tế quy mô)

text: ___________ is a large package of press-packed goods (often raw material), which is tightly bound, wrapped, and banded. (Một gói lớn vật liệu nén chặt được buộc an toàn bằng dây, thường được gói trong giấy.)
___________ is the process in which goods are brought together to form vehicle loads and are then loaded onto vehicles for onward dispatch.
The process of overseeing and controlling the movement of goods in a company, from the time they are ordered to the time they are sold is called ___________.
___________ is a certificate prepared by the shipper or consignor which states that hazardous goods are handled according to international shipping regulations.

options.d: Dangerous goods declaration (tờ khai hàng hóa nguy hiểm)

text: ___________ is a specific document required by customs in some countries when importing goods. It includes more details than a commercial invoice.

___________ freight transport refers to the transportation of goods in the same loading unit or vehicle using different modes of transport. The handling of the freight itself is not necessary when changing modes.

options.c: Intermodal freight transport (vận tải đa phương thức)

text: ___________ is a system of transporting cargo in separate pieces instead of containers. It is typically used for individual items that are large and heavy in size and weight.
___________ is a type of freight traffic in which a train is formed out of individual wagons or sets of wagons which have different origins and different destinations.

___________ is the excess inventory in the facility after the primary storage locations are filled. This is typically not available to directly fulfill orders but is used to replenish primary locations when they drop below a certain threshold.
___________ is a special kind of invoice sometimes required by the importing country. It needs to be approved by an embassy or consular.

___________ refers to goods kept in store to cover unforeseen shortages or fluctuations in demand. (hàng tồn kho đệm; lượng hàng không nằm trong kế hoạch tiêu thụ ban đầu, nhưng được dự trữ sử dụng trong trường hợp khẩn cấp.)
___________ is a place at the side of a building where goods are put onto and taken from vehicles to be brought inside the warehouse.

options.d: Unloading bay (Khu vực dỡ hàng hoá ra khỏi (tàu, xe, container,…))

text: ___________ is a large cylindrical (hình trụ) or curved container with a flat bottom and top. It is made of wood or metal and is used for liquids (thùng áp dụng cho các hàng hóa như dầu, hóa chất).
___________ is the area of logistics that involves managing the flow of finished products and information to business buyers and ultimate consumers.
The purchase price of a product that excludes transport costs is defined as ___________. (Định giá tại cổng nhà máy là một phương pháp loại bỏ các chi phí vận chuyển không cần thiết).

___________ can be used for delicate cargo and perishables (dễ hư hỏng như rau, hoa quả). It is temperature controlled and is particularly suitable for cargo that needs regulated or cool temperatures.
___________ is a standard container frame with a tank fitted inside to ship liquids, for example, foodstuffs or chemicals.
___________ is an offer for goods or services that follows a request for a quotation made by an official body, e.g. local government.
___________ transport which is also known as combined transport is the transportation of goods under a single contract, but performed with at least two different modes of transport.

___________ is a contract between airline and shipper. It is a shipping document which states the terms and conditions of carriage and is also a receipt for the consignment. (Vận đơn hàng không là chứng từ do người chuyên chở phát hành để xác nhận việc nhận lô hàng để vận chuyển bằng máy bay.)
___________ is the amount that a vehicle or container weighs when it is full of passengers or goods. (Gross Weight là tổng trọng lượng của hàng hóa bao gồm cả bao bì.)
A mode of shipping when the cargo is not enough to fill up an entire container is abbreviated as ___________.
___________ is a small vehicle with two or four wheels that you push or pull to transport large or heavy objects on.
___________ is the weight of a product without its container or package. (Khối lượng của hàng hóa không bao gồm các loại bao bì đóng gói.)
___________ is the most common form of document that contains specific information regarding the goods shipped and the conditions agreed between buyer and seller.
___________ is a lorry, truck or other large vehicle used to transport cargo with a total weight of at least 3.5 tonnes.
In the ___________ area, goods are selected in the right quantities ordered by the customer.
___________ indicates products that have similar characteristics regarding their selling profile are categorized into 'families'.
___________ means real-time demand which is identified by an electronic cash register and the product movement is coordinated from supplier to the retail store.
___________ is used for bulky cargo. It comes with a PVC tarpaulin cover instead of a roof panel to allow loading from the top. The doors can be removed to make loading easier.
___________ is the process of identifying items on a conveyor system and diverting them to specific destinations.
___________ has a flat bottom, used for carrying goods and people on canals and rivers.
___________ is especially designed for heavy loads such as heavy machinery and pipes.
___________ is a document used in foreign trade which states where the goods were produced. It is often required by customs authorities.
___________ is a wooden box made of wooden slats. It can be open or closed and is used for packing goods.
___________ is a draft invoice which the seller prepares before the actual shipment takes place.
___________ is a portable plastic box with a lid and handle used for storage and handling of parts or materials.
In the ___________ area, products are packed into cartons or cases or wrapped using stretch-wrapping or shrink-wrapping.
One of the planning techniques which is similar to CRP is called ___________. It is often used for products that need to be supplied frequently and in small batch sizes.
___________ refers to the method in which the buyer is given documents when a payment is made to the bank.
___________ is a container for dry cargo. It comes with a timber floor and has various lashing devices to secure the load.
___________ is the time it takes to produce and supply a product.
___________ is a document which is granted by a government authority and states that specified goods can be exported.
___________ is a jack or pump used to lift and move pallets.
___________ is a planning technique which refers to a concept of reducing inventories by coordinating the delivery of materials just before they are needed.
___________ is industrial-grade containers engineered for the mass handling, transport, and storage of liquids, semi-solids, pastes, or solids.
___________ is a highway trailer, or semi-trailer, that is specially equipped for use in railroad intermodal service.
The weight of an empty vehicle or container, which is sometimes called unladen weight, is ___________.

___________ is a contract between carrier and shipper which specifies the goods to be shipped and the delivery terms. It is also a receipt of shipment and accompanies the goods until they reach their destination.

___________ is one type of containers which has 4 up-folding legs under their frame make it possible to change, or swap, their body from one carriage to another. It is not stackable, and must be lifted by the bottom frame.
The amount of goods or people that a vehicle, such as a truck or aircraft, can carry is referred to as ___________.
___________ freight is the transport of wheeled freight without the driver and cab. Essentially, the freight vehicle is left at the quayside at the port by a driver.

___________ are mobile cages, used as a convenient method of moving and transporting a whole variety of goods and products, efficiently and safely within a warehouse environment or between various destinations.
A grasping device which has hinged tines or jaws that close around an object or load, used especially in lifting or dragging heavy items is called ___________.
